verses.roman:
kaccit smarati vā bandhūn
pitaraṁ mātaraṁ ca saḥ
apy asau mātaraṁ draṣṭuṁ
sakṛd apy āgamiṣyati
api vā smarate 'smākam
anusevāṁ mahā-bhujaḥ

synonyms: kaccit—whether; smarati—remembers; vā—or; bandhūn—His family members; pitaram—His father; mātaram—His mother; saḥ—He; api—also; asau—Himself; mātaram—His mother; draṣṭum—to see; sakṛt—once; api—even; api—indeed; vā—or; smarate—He remembers; asmākam—our; anusevām—steady service; mahā—mighty; bhujaḥ—whose arms.
translation: "Does He remember His family members, especially His father and mother? Do you think He will ever come back even once to see His mother? And does mighty-armed Kṛṣṇa remember the service we always did for Him?

purport.content: Śrīla Viśvanātha Cakravartī comments that the gopīs would render service to Lord Kṛṣṇa by stringing flower garlands, skillfully using perfumes, and constructing fans, beds and canopies out of flower petals. By these simple acts of love, the gopīs rendered the greatest service to the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
